thread.title: At least 28 people injured in New Orleans truck horror - ITV News
thread.title_full: At least 28 people injured in New Orleans truck horror - ITV News

title: At least 28 people injured in New Orleans truck horror - ITV News
text:
26 February 2017 at 2:42am At least 28 people injured in New Orleans truck horror Thousands of people lined the streets for the annual celebrations Credit: APTN 
At least 28 people were injured when a suspected drunk driver ploughed into a crowd during a Mardi Gras festival in New Orleans. 
A man was arrested at the scene, police confirmed, as paramedics treated victims as young as three who had been celebrating at the famous Endymion parade. 
There were "no serious life threats", a police officer told reporters, adding that terrorism is not suspected. 
The driver, who has not been named, "was intoxicated" and is being "investigated at the DWI [driving while impaired] office", the officer added. 
Michael G Tidwell, New Orleans Police Department, said: "The NOPD is investigating a crash where a vehicle ran into a crowd of people at the intersection of Orleans and Carrollton Avenue." 
More to follow. 
Sorry, this content isn't available on your device. Last updated Sun 26 Feb 2017
